name: Maududi
text: Kaf. Ha'. Ya'. Ayn. Sad.

name: Maududi
text: This is an account of the mercy of your Lord to His servant Zechariah

name: Maududi
text: when he cried to his Lord in secret.

name: Maududi
text: He said: "Lord! My bones have grown feeble and my head is glistening with age; yet, never have my prayers to You, my Lord, been unfruitful.

name: Maududi
text: I fear evil from my kinsmen after I am gone; and my wife is barren, so grant me an heir out of Your special grace,

name: Maududi
text: one that might be my heir and the heir of the house of Jacob; and make him, Lord, one that will be pleasing to You.

name: Maududi
text: (He was told): "Zechariah, We bring you the good news of the birth of a son whose name shall be Yahya (John), one whose namesake We never created before."

name: Maududi
text: He said: "My Lord! How can I have a boy when my wife is barren and I have reached an extremely old age?"

name: Maududi
text: He answered: "So shall it be." Your Lord says: "It is easy for Me," and then added: "For beyond doubt, I created you earlier when you were nothing."

name: Maududi
text: Zechariah said: "Lord, grant me a Sign." Said He: "Your Sign is that you shall not be able to speak to people for three nights, though you will be otherwise sound."

name: Maududi
text: Thereupon Zechariah came out from the sanctuary and directed his people by gestures to extol His glory by day and by night.

name: Maududi
text: "O John! Hold the Book with all your strength." We had bestowed wisdom upon him while he was still a child;

name: Maududi
text: and We also endowed him with tenderness and purity, and he was exceedingly pious

name: Maududi
text: and cherishing to his parents. Never was he insolent or rebellious.

name: Maududi
text: Peace be upon him the day he was born, and the day he will die, and the day he will be raised up alive.

name: Maududi
text: (O Muhammad), recite in the Book the account of Mary, when she withdrew from her people to a place towards the east;

name: Maududi
text: and drew a curtain, screening herself from people whereupon We sent to her Our spirit and he appeared to her as a well-shaped man.

name: Maududi
text: Mary exclaimed: "I surely take refuge from you with the Most Compassionate Lord, if you are at all God-fearing."

name: Maududi
text: He said: "I am just a message-bearer of your Lord, I have come to grant you a most pure boy."

name: Maududi
text: Mary said: "How can a boy be born to me when no man has even touched me, nor have I ever been unchaste?"

name: Maududi
text: The angel said: "Thus shall it be. Your Lord says: 'It is easy for Me; and We shall do so in order to make him a Sign for mankind and a mercy from Us. This has been decreed.' "

name: Maududi
text: Then she conceived him and withdrew with him to a far-off place.

name: Maududi
text: Then the birth pangs drove her to the trunk of a palm-tree and she said: "Oh, would that I had died before this and had been all forgotten."

name: Maududi
text: Thereupon the angel below her cried out: "Grieve not, for your Lord has caused a stream of water to flow beneath you.

name: Maududi
text: Shake the trunk of the palm-tree towards yourself and fresh and ripe dates shall fall upon you.

name: Maududi
text: So eat and drink and cool your eyes; and if you see any person say to him: 'Verily I have vowed a fast to the Most Compassionate Lord, and so I shall not speak to anyone today.' "

name: Maududi
text: Then she came to her people, carrying her baby. They said: "O Mary! You have committed a monstrous thing.

name: Maududi
text: O sister of Aaron! Your father was not an evil man, nor was your mother an unchaste woman."

name: Maududi
text: Thereupon Mary pointed to the child. They exclaimed: "How can we speak to one who is in the cradle, a mere child?"

name: Maududi
text: The child cried out: "Verily I am Allah's servant. He has granted me the Book and has made me a Prophet

name: Maududi
text: and has blessed me wherever I might be and has enjoined upon me Prayer and Zakah (purifying alms) as long as I live;

name: Maududi
text: and has made me dutiful to my mother. He has not made me oppressive, nor bereft of God's blessings.

name: Maududi
text: Peace be upon me the day I was born and the day I will die, and the day I will be raised up alive."

name: Maududi
text: This is Jesus, the son of Mary; and this is the truth about him concerning which they are in doubt.

name: Maududi
text: It does not befit Allah to take for Himself a son. Glory be to Him! When He decrees a thing He only says: "Be" and it is.

name: Maududi
text: (Jesus had said): "Indeed Allah is my Lord and your Lord, so serve Him alone. This is the Straight Way."

name: Maududi
text: But different parties began to dispute with one another. A dreadful woe awaits on that great Day for those that reject the Truth.

name: Maududi
text: How well shall they hear and how well shall they see on the Day they come to Us! But today the evil-doers are in manifest error.

name: Maududi
text: (O Muhammad), warn those who are steeped in heedlessness and are obstinately rejecting the truth that the Day shall come when things will be finally decided and they shall be left with utter remorse.

name: Maududi
text: Ultimately, We shall inherit the earth and whatever is on it; to Us shall they be returned.

name: Maududi
text: (O Muhammad), recite in the Book the account of Abraham. Most surely he was a man of truth, a Prophet.

name: Maududi
text: (And remind people) when he said to his father: "Father! Why do you worship that which neither sees nor hears, and which can be of no avail to you?

name: Maududi
text: Father, a knowledge that has not reached you has come to me. So follow me that I may guide you to a Straight Way.

name: Maududi
text: Father, do not serve Satan, for Satan has indeed been a persistent rebel against the Most Compassionate Lord.

name: Maududi
text: Father, I fear that a punishment from the Most Compassionate Lord might strike you and you may end up as one of Satan's companions?"

name: Maududi
text: The father said: "Abraham, have you turned away from my gods? If you do not give this up, I shall stone you to death. Now begone from me forever."

name: Maududi
text: Abraham answered: "Peace be upon you. I shall seek pardon for you from my Lord. My Lord has always been kind to Me.

name: Maududi
text: I shall withdraw from you and all that you call upon beside Allah. I shall only call upon my Lord. I trust the prayer to my Lord will not go unanswered."

name: Maududi
text: Thereupon Abraham dissociated himself from his people and the deities they worshipped instead of Allah, and We bestowed upon him Isaac and Jacob and made each of them a Prophet;

name: Maududi
text: and We bestowed on them Our mercy, and granted them a truly lofty renown.

name: Maududi
text: And recite in the Book the account of Moses. He was a chosen one, a Messenger, a Prophet.

name: Maududi
text: We called out to him from the right side of the Mount, and We drew him near to Us by communing to him in secret,

name: Maududi
text: and out of Our mercy We appointed his brother Aaron, a Prophet (that he may assist him).

name: Maududi
text: And recite in the Book the account of Ishmael. He was ever true to his promise, and was a Messenger, a Prophet.

name: Maududi
text: He enjoined his household to observe Prayer and to give Zakah (purifying alms); and his Lord was well pleased with him.

name: Maududi
text: And recite in the Book the account of Idris. He was a man of truth, a Prophet;

name: Maududi
text: and We exalted him to a lofty position.

name: Maududi
text: These are the Prophets upon whom Allah bestowed His favour from the seed of Adam, and from the seed of those whom We carried (in the Ark) with Noah, and from the seed of Abraham and Israel. They were those whom We guided and chose (for an exalted position). They were such that when the words of the Most Compassionate Lord were recited to them, they fell down in prostration, weeping.

name: Maududi
text: They were succeeded by a people who neglected the Prayers and pursued their lusts. They shall presently meet with their doom,

name: Maududi
text: except those who repent and believe and act righteously. Such shall enter Paradise and shall not be wronged at all.

name: Maududi
text: Theirs shall be everlasting Gardens which the Most Compassionate Lord has promised His servants in a realm which is beyond the ken of perception. Surely His promise shall he fulfilled.

name: Maududi
text: They shall not hear in it anything vain; they shall hear only what is good; and they shall have their provision in it, morning and evening.

name: Maududi
text: Such is the Paradise which We shall cause those of Our servants who have been God-fearing to inherit.

name: Maududi
text: (The angels will say): "(O Muhammad!) We descend not except by the command of your Lord. To Him belongs all that is before us and all that is behind us, and all that is in between. Your Lord is not forgetful in the least.

name: Maududi
text: He is the Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that is in between. Serve Him, then, and be constant in serving Him. Do you know anyone that might be His compeer?"

name: Maududi
text: Man is prone to say: "Shall I be raised to life after I die?"

name: Maududi
text: Does man not remember that We created him before when he was nothing?

name: Maududi
text: By your Lord, We will surely muster them and the devils together. Then We will surely bring them all, on their knees, around Hell,

name: Maududi
text: and then We will draw aside from each party those who were most rebellious against the Most Compassionate Lord,

name: Maududi
text: and then We shall know well all those most worthy to be cast in Hell.

name: Maududi
text: There is not one of you but shall pass by Hell. This is a decree which your Lord will fulfil.

name: Maududi
text: Then We shall deliver those that feared Allah and leave the wrong-doers there on their knees.

name: Maududi
text: When Our clear revelations are recited to those who deny the Truth they are wont to say to those who have faith: "Which of the two groups has a better status and whose assemblies are grander?"

name: Maududi
text: How numerous are the peoples We destroyed before them - those that were more resourceful and grander in outward appearance!

name: Maududi
text: Say: "The Most Compassionate Lord grants respite to those who stray into error, until they behold what they had been threatened with, either God's chastisement (in the world) or the Hour (of Resurrection)" - then they fully know whose station is worse, and who is weaker in hosts!

name: Maududi
text: (On the contrary), Allah increases in guidance those who follow the Right Way. Lasting acts of righteousness are better in the sight of your Lord as reward and conducive to a better end.

name: Maududi
text: Have you seen him who rejected Our signs and said: "Surely I shall continue to be favoured with riches and children."

name: Maududi
text: Has he obtained knowledge of the Unseen, or has he taken a covenant with the Most Compassionate Lord?

name: Maududi
text: By no means! We shall write down all what he says; and We shall greatly prolong his chastisement,

name: Maududi
text: and We shall inherit all the resources and hosts of which he boasts, and he will come to Us all alone.

name: Maududi
text: They have taken other gods instead of Allah that they may be a source of strength for them.

name: Maududi
text: By no means! They shall soon deny their worship and shall become their adversaries instead.

name: Maududi
text: Do you not see that We have sent devils upon the unbelievers who greatly incite them (to oppose the Truth)?

name: Maududi
text: Therefore, do not hasten (in seeking a scourge against them). We are counting their days.

name: Maududi
text: The Day shall soon come when We shall bring together the God-fearing to the Most Compassionate Lord, as honoured guests;

name: Maududi
text: and We shall drive the guilty ones to Hell as a thirsty herd.

name: Maududi
text: On that Day none will have the power to intercede for them except those who received a sanction from the Most Compassionate Lord.

name: Maududi
text: They claim: "The Most Compassionate Lord has taken a son to Himself."

name: Maududi
text: Surely you have made a monstrous statement.

name: Maududi
text: It is such a monstrosity that heavens might well-nigh burst forth at it, the earth might be cleaved, and the mountains fall

name: Maududi
text: at their ascribing a son to the Most Compassionate Lord.

name: Maududi
text: It does not befit the Most Compassionate Lord that He should take a son.

name: Maududi
text: There is no one in the heavens and the earth but he shall come to the Most Compassionate Lord as His servant.

name: Maududi
text: Verily He encompasses them and has counted them all.

name: Maududi
text: On the Day of Resurrection each one of these will come to Him singly.

name: Maududi
text: Indeed, the Most Compassionate Lord will soon create enduring love for those who believe and do righteous works.

name: Maududi
text: Therefore, We have revealed the Qur'an in your tongue and made it easy to understand that you may give glad tidings to the God-fearing and warn a contentious people.

name: Maududi
text: How numerous are the peoples that We destroyed before them! Do you now perceive any one of them, or hear even their whisper?
